1â†’import Foundation
     2â†’
     3â†’// MARK: - Stock
     4â†’struct Stock: Codable, Identifiable, Hashable {
     5â†’    let id: String
     6â†’    let symbol: String
     7â†’    let name: String
     8â†’    var lots: [StockLot]
     9â†’    var currentPrice: Double?
    10â†’    var previousClose: Double?
    11â†’    var currency: String
    12â†’    var lastUpdated: Date?
    13â†’
    14â†’    // Computed properties
    15â†’    var totalShares: Double {
    16â†’        lots.reduce(0) { $0 + $1.shares }
    17â†’    }
    18â†’
    19â†’    var totalCost: Double {
    20â†’        lots.reduce(0) { $0 + ($1.shares * $1.pricePerShare) }
    21â†’    }
    22â†’
    23â†’    var averageCost: Double {
    24â†’        guard totalShares > 0 else { return 0 }
    25â†’        return totalCost / totalShares
    26â†’    }
    27â†’
    28â†’    var currentValue: Double {
    29â†’        guard let price = currentPrice else { return 0 }
    30â†’        return totalShares * price
    31â†’    }
    32â†’
    33â†’    var profitLoss: Double {
    34â†’        currentValue - totalCost
    35â†’    }
    36â†’
    37â†’    var profitLossPercentage: Double {
    38â†’        guard totalCost > 0 else { return 0 }
    39â†’        return (profitLoss / totalCost) * 100
    40â†’    }
    41â†’
    42â†’    var dayChange: Double? {
    43â†’        guard let current = currentPrice, let previous = previousClose else { return nil }
    44â†’        return current - previous
    45â†’    }
    46â†’
    47â†’    var dayChangePercentage: Double? {
    48â†’        guard let previous = previousClose, previous > 0, let change = dayChange else { return nil }
    49â†’        return (change / previous) * 100
    50â†’    }

    52â†’    init(id: String = UUID().uuidString,
    53â†’         symbol: String,

    55â†’         lots: [StockLot] = [],

    58â†’         currency: String = "USD",
    59â†’         lastUpdated: Date? = nil) {
    60â†’        self.id = id

    62â†’        self.name = name
    63â†’        self.lots = lots
    64â†’        self.currentPrice = currentPrice
    65â†’        self.previousClose = previousClose
    66â†’        self.currency = currency
    67â†’        self.lastUpdated = lastUpdated
    68â†’    }
    69â†’}

    97â†’
    98â†’    // MARK: - Custom Codable
    99â†’
   100â†’    enum CodingKeys: String, CodingKey {
   101â†’        case id

   103â†’        case pricePerShare = "price"  // API uses "price"
   104â†’        case purchaseDate = "date"     // API uses "date"
   105â†’        case currency

   111â†’struct HistoricalDataPoint: Codable, Identifiable, Hashable {

1â†’import Foundation
     2â†’
     3â†’// MARK: - NewsArticle
     4â†’struct NewsArticle: Codable, Identifiable, Hashable {
     5â†’    let id: String
     6â†’    let title: String
     7â†’    let url: String
     8â†’    let source: String
     9â†’    let publishedAt: Date
    10â†’    let imageUrl: String?
    11â†’    var sentiment: NewsSentiment?
    12â†’    var summary: String?
    13â†’
    14â†’    init(id: String = UUID().uuidString,
    15â†’         title: String,
    16â†’         url: String,
    17â†’         source: String,
    18â†’         publishedAt: Date,
    19â†’         imageUrl: String? = nil,
    20â†’         sentiment: NewsSentiment? = nil,
    21â†’         summary: String? = nil) {
    22â†’        self.id = id
    23â†’        self.title = title
    24â†’        self.url = url
    25â†’        self.source = source
    26â†’        self.publishedAt = publishedAt
    27â†’        self.imageUrl = imageUrl
    28â†’        self.sentiment = sentiment
    29â†’        self.summary = summary
    30â†’    }
    31â†’
    32â†’    enum CodingKeys: String, CodingKey {
    33â†’        case id
    34â†’        case title
    35â†’        case url = "link"  // API uses "link"
    36â†’        case source
    37â†’        case publishedAt
    38â†’        case imageUrl
    39â†’        case sentiment
    40â†’        case summary
    41â†’    }
    42â†’
    43â†’    // Custom decoder to handle API format
    44â†’    init(from decoder: Decoder) throws {
    45â†’        let container = try decoder.container(keyedBy: CodingKeys.self)
    46â†’
    47â†’        // Generate ID if not provided by API
    48â†’        self.id = (try? container.decode(String.self, forKey: .id)) ?? UUID().uuidString
    49â†’
    50â†’        self.title = try container.decode(String.self, forKey: .title)
    51â†’        self.url = try container.decode(String.self, forKey: .url)
    52â†’        self.source = try container.decode(String.self, forKey: .source)
    53â†’        self.imageUrl = try? container.decode(String.self, forKey: .imageUrl)
    54â†’        self.summary = try? container.decode(String.self, forKey: .summary)
    55â†’
    56â†’        // Handle publishedAt - try multiple date formats
    57â†’        if let dateString = try? container.decode(String.self, forKey: .publishedAt) {
    58â†’            // Try RFC2822 format first (e.g., "Wed, 04 Feb 2026 23:59:09 GMT")
    59â†’            let rfc2822Formatter = DateFormatter()
    60â†’            rfc2822Formatter.dateFormat = "EEE, dd MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss zzz"
    61â†’            rfc2822Formatter.locale = Locale(identifier: "en_US_POSIX")
    62â†’
    63â†’            if let date = rfc2822Formatter.date(from: dateString) {
    64â†’                self.publishedAt = date
    65â†’            } else {
    66â†’                // Try ISO8601 as fallback
    67â†’                let iso8601Formatter = ISO8601DateFormatter()
    68â†’                self.publishedAt = iso8601Formatter.date(from: dateString) ?? Date()
    69â†’            }
    70â†’        } else {
    71â†’            self.publishedAt = Date()
    72â†’        }
    73â†’
    74â†’        // Handle sentiment - API may return simple string, full object, or nothing
    75â†’        if let sentimentString = try? container.decode(String.self, forKey: .sentiment) {
    76â†’            // API returns simple string like "neutral", "Positive", "NEGATIVE", etc.
    77â†’            if let label = SentimentLabel(caseInsensitive: sentimentString) {
    78â†’                let score: Double
    79â†’                switch label {
    80â†’                case .positive: score = 0.5
    81â†’                case .neutral: score = 0.0
    82â†’                case .negative: score = -0.5
    83â†’                }
    84â†’                self.sentiment = NewsSentiment(score: score, label: label, confidence: 0.5)
    85â†’            } else {
    86â†’                #if DEBUG
    87â†’                print("âš ï¸ Unknown sentiment string: '\(sentimentString)'")
    88â†’                #endif
    89â†’                self.sentiment = nil
    90â†’            }
    91â†’        } else if let sentimentObj = try? container.decode(NewsSentiment.self, forKey: .sentiment) {
    92â†’            self.sentiment = sentimentObj
    93â†’        } else {
    94â†’            #if DEBUG
    95â†’            print("âš ï¸ No sentiment decoded for article: \(self.title.prefix(50))")
    96â†’            #endif
    97â†’            self.sentiment = nil
    98â†’        }
    99â†’    }
   100â†’}
   101â†’
   102â†’// MARK: - NewsSentiment
   103â†’struct NewsSentiment: Codable, Hashable {
   104â†’    let score: Double // -1.0 to 1.0
   105â†’    let label: SentimentLabel
   106â†’    let confidence: Double // 0.0 to 1.0
   107â†’
   108â†’    var color: String {
   109â†’        switch label {
   110â†’        case .positive: return "green"
   111â†’        case .neutral: return "gray"
   112â†’        case .negative: return "red"
   113â†’        }
   114â†’    }
   115â†’
   116â†’    init(score: Double, label: SentimentLabel, confidence: Double) {
   117â†’        self.score = score
   118â†’        self.label = label
   119â†’        self.confidence = confidence
   120â†’    }
   121â†’
   122â†’    init(from decoder: Decoder) throws {
   123â†’        let container = try decoder.container(keyedBy: CodingKeys.self)
   124â†’        self.label = try container.decode(SentimentLabel.self, forKey: .label)
   125â†’        self.score = (try? container.decode(Double.self, forKey: .score)) ?? 0.0
   126â†’        self.confidence = (try? container.decode(Double.self, forKey: .confidence)) ?? 0.5
   127â†’    }
   128â†’
   129â†’    enum CodingKeys: String, CodingKey {
   130â†’        case score, label, confidence
   131â†’    }
   132â†’}
   133â†’
   134â†’// MARK: - SentimentLabel
   135â†’enum SentimentLabel: String, Codable, CaseIterable {
   136â†’    case positive = "positive"
   137â†’    case neutral = "neutral"
   138â†’    case negative = "negative"
   139â†’
   140â†’    /// Case-insensitive initializer to handle "Positive", "POSITIVE", etc.
   141â†’    init?(caseInsensitive value: String) {
   142â†’        self.init(rawValue: value.lowercased())
   143â†’    }
   144â†’
   145â†’    init(from decoder: Decoder) throws {
   146â†’        let container = try decoder.singleValueContainer()
   147â†’        let rawString = try container.decode(String.self)
   148â†’        guard let label = SentimentLabel(caseInsensitive: rawString) else {
   149â†’            throw DecodingError.dataCorruptedError(in: container, debugDescription: "Unknown sentiment label: \(rawString)")
   150â†’        }
   151â†’        self = label
   152â†’    }
   153â†’
   154â†’    var displayName: String {
   155â†’        rawValue.capitalized
   156â†’    }
   157â†’
   158â†’    var emoji: String {
   159â†’        switch self {
   160â†’        case .positive: return "ðŸ“ˆ"
   161â†’        case .neutral: return "âž–"
   162â†’        case .negative: return "ðŸ“‰"
   163â†’        }
   164â†’    }
   165â†’}
   166â†’
   167â†’// MARK: - NewsResponse
   168â†’struct NewsResponse: Codable {
   169â†’    let articles: [NewsArticle]
   170â†’    let cachedAt: String?
   171â†’    let expiresAt: String?
   172â†’    let hasSentiment: Bool
   173â†’
   174â†’    var count: Int { articles.count }
   175â†’
   176â†’    init(articles: [NewsArticle], hasSentiment: Bool = false, cachedAt: String? = nil, expiresAt: String? = nil) {
   177â†’        self.articles = articles
   178â†’        self.hasSentiment = hasSentiment
   179â†’        self.cachedAt = cachedAt
   180â†’        self.expiresAt = expiresAt
   181â†’    }
   182â†’
   183â†’    init(from decoder: Decoder) throws {
   184â†’        let container = try decoder.container(keyedBy: CodingKeys.self)
   185â†’        self.articles = try container.decode([NewsArticle].self, forKey: .articles)
   186â†’        self.cachedAt = try? container.decode(String.self, forKey: .cachedAt)
   187â†’        self.expiresAt = try? container.decode(String.self, forKey: .expiresAt)
   188â†’        self.hasSentiment = (try? container.decode(Bool.self, forKey: .hasSentiment)) ?? false
   189â†’    }
   190â†’
   191â†’    enum CodingKeys: String, CodingKey {
   192â†’        case articles, cachedAt, expiresAt, hasSentiment
   193â†’    }
   194â†’}
   195â†’
   196â†’// MARK: - NewsSummaryRequest
   197â†’struct NewsSummaryRequest: Codable {
   198â†’    let articleUrl: String
   199â†’    let articleTitle: String
   200â†’    let source: String
   201â†’}
   202â†’
   203â†’// MARK: - NewsSummaryResponse
   204â†’struct NewsSummaryResponse: Codable {
   205â†’    let summary: String
   206â†’    let cachedAt: String?
   207â†’}
   208â†’
   209â†’// MARK: - CachedNews
   210â†’struct CachedNews: Codable {
   211â†’    let articles: [NewsArticle]
   212â†’    let cachedAt: Date
   213â†’    let symbol: String
   214â†’    let hasSentiment: Bool
   215â†’
   216â†’    var isExpired: Bool {
   217â†’        let sixHours: TimeInterval = 6 * 60 * 60
   218â†’        return Date().timeIntervalSince(cachedAt) > sixHours
   219â†’    }
   220â†’
   221â†’    init(articles: [NewsArticle], symbol: String, hasSentiment: Bool = false, cachedAt: Date = Date()) {
   222â†’        self.articles = articles
   223â†’        self.cachedAt = cachedAt
   224â†’        self.symbol = symbol
   225â†’        self.hasSentiment = hasSentiment
   226â†’    }
   227â†’}
   228â†’

1â†’import Foundation
     2â†’
     3â†’// MARK: - SubscriptionTier
     4â†’enum SubscriptionTier: String, Codable, CaseIterable {
     5â†’    case free = "free"
     6â†’    case paid = "paid"
     7â†’
     8â†’    var displayName: String {
     9â†’        switch self {
    10â†’        case .free: return "Free"
    11â†’        case .paid: return "Premium"
    12â†’        }
    13â†’    }
    14â†’
    15â†’    var maxStocks: Int? {
    16â†’        switch self {
    17â†’        case .free: return 5
    18â†’        case .paid: return nil // unlimited
    19â†’        }
    20â†’    }
    21â†’
    22â†’    var hasNewsSentiment: Bool {
    23â†’        switch self {
    24â†’        case .free: return false
    25â†’        case .paid: return true
    26â†’        }
    27â†’    }
    28â†’
    29â†’    var features: [String] {
    30â†’        switch self {
    31â†’        case .free:
    32â†’            return [
    33â†’                "Track up to 5 stocks",
    34â†’                "Real-time prices",
    35â†’                "Interactive charts",
    36â†’                "Basic news feed"
    37â†’            ]
    38â†’        case .paid:
    39â†’            return [
    40â†’                "Unlimited stocks",
    41â†’                "Real-time prices",
    42â†’                "Interactive charts",
    43â†’                "AI news sentiment analysis",
    44â†’                "Article summaries",
    45â†’                "Cloud sync across devices",
    46â†’                "Priority support"
    47â†’            ]
    48â†’        }
    49â†’    }
    50â†’}
    51â†’
    52â†’// MARK: - SubscriptionState
    53â†’struct SubscriptionState: Codable {
    54â†’    var tier: SubscriptionTier
    55â†’    var productId: String?
    56â†’    var purchaseDate: Date?
    57â†’    var expirationDate: Date?
    58â†’    var isActive: Bool
    59â†’    var lastValidated: Date?
    60â†’
    61â†’    var isExpired: Bool {
    62â†’        guard let expiration = expirationDate else { return false }
    63â†’        return Date() > expiration
    64â†’    }
    65â†’
    66â†’    var daysUntilExpiration: Int? {
    67â†’        guard let expiration = expirationDate else { return nil }
    68â†’        let days = Calendar.current.dateComponents([.day], from: Date(), to: expiration).day
    69â†’        return days
    70â†’    }
    71â†’
    72â†’    init(tier: SubscriptionTier = .free,
    73â†’         productId: String? = nil,
    74â†’         purchaseDate: Date? = nil,
    75â†’         expirationDate: Date? = nil,
    76â†’         isActive: Bool = false,
    77â†’         lastValidated: Date? = nil) {
    78â†’        self.tier = tier
    79â†’        self.productId = productId
    80â†’        self.purchaseDate = purchaseDate
    81â†’        self.expirationDate = expirationDate
    82â†’        self.isActive = isActive
    83â†’        self.lastValidated = lastValidated
    84â†’    }
    85â†’}
    86â†’
    87â†’// MARK: - SubscriptionProduct
    88â†’struct SubscriptionProduct: Identifiable {
    89â†’    let id: String
    90â†’    let displayName: String
    91â†’    let description: String
    92â†’    let price: String
    93â†’    let tier: SubscriptionTier
    94â†’
    95â†’    static let monthly = SubscriptionProduct(
    96â†’        id: "com.equitylabs.premium.monthly",
    97â†’        displayName: "Premium Monthly",
    98â†’        description: "Unlock all premium features",
    99â†’        price: "$4.99/month",
   100â†’        tier: .paid
   101â†’    )
   102â†’}
   103â†’
   104â†’// MARK: - ReceiptValidationRequest
   105â†’struct ReceiptValidationRequest: Codable {
   106â†’    let receiptData: String
   107â†’    let productId: String
   108â†’}
   109â†’
   110â†’// MARK: - ReceiptValidationResponse
   111â†’struct ReceiptValidationResponse: Codable {
   112â†’    let isValid: Bool
   113â†’    let expiresAt: String?
   114â†’    let tier: SubscriptionTier
   115â†’    let message: String?
   116â†’}

1â†’import Foundation
     2â†’import Combine
     3â†’
     4â†’// MARK: - APIClient
     5â†’@MainActor
     6â†’class APIClient: ObservableObject {
     7â†’    static let shared = APIClient()
     8â†’
     9â†’    private let session: URLSession
    10â†’    private let decoder: JSONDecoder
    11â†’    private let encoder: JSONEncoder
    12â†’    private var authToken: String?
    13â†’    private var tokenProvider: (() async throws -> String?)?
    14â†’
    15â†’    private init() {
    16â†’        let configuration = URLSessionConfiguration.default
    17â†’        configuration.timeoutIntervalForRequest = 30
    18â†’        configuration.timeoutIntervalForResource = 60
    19â†’        configuration.waitsForConnectivity = true
    20â†’
    21â†’        self.session = URLSession(configuration: configuration)
    22â†’
    23â†’        self.decoder = JSONDecoder()
    24â†’        self.decoder.dateDecodingStrategy = .iso8601
    25â†’
    26â†’        self.encoder = JSONEncoder()
    27â†’        self.encoder.dateEncodingStrategy = .iso8601
    28â†’    }
    29â†’
    30â†’    // MARK: - Authentication
    31â†’    func setAuthToken(_ token: String?) {
    32â†’        self.authToken = token
    33â†’    }
    34â†’
    35â†’    /// Set a token provider that fetches a fresh JWT before each request.
    36â†’    /// This ensures Clerk short-lived tokens are always valid.
    37â†’    func setTokenProvider(_ provider: @escaping () async throws -> String?) {
    38â†’        self.tokenProvider = provider
    39â†’    }
    40â†’
    41â†’    /// Get a fresh auth token, preferring the token provider over the static token.
    42â†’    private func getActiveToken() async -> String? {
    43â†’        if let provider = tokenProvider {
    44â†’            return try? await provider()
    45â†’        }
    46â†’        return authToken
    47â†’    }
    48â†’
    49â†’    // MARK: - Request Methods
    50â†’    func request<T: Decodable>(_ endpoint: APIEndpoint) async throws -> T {
    51â†’        let url = try endpoint.buildURL()
    52â†’        var request = URLRequest(url: url)
    53â†’        request.httpMethod = endpoint.method.rawValue
    54â†’        request.setValue("application/json", forHTTPHeaderField: "Content-Type")
    55â†’
    56â†’        if let token = await getActiveToken() {
    57â†’            request.setValue("Bearer \(token)", forHTTPHeaderField: "Authorization")
    58â†’        } else {
    59â†’            #if DEBUG
    60â†’            print("âš ï¸ WARNING: No auth token set - request will fail!")
    61â†’            #endif
    62â†’        }
    63â†’
    64â†’        #if DEBUG
    65â†’        print("ðŸŒ API Request: \(endpoint.method.rawValue) \(url.absoluteString)")
    66â†’        #endif
    67â†’
    68â†’        return try await performRequest(request)
    69â†’    }
    70â†’
    71â†’    func upload<T: Decodable, Body: Encodable>(_ endpoint: APIEndpoint, body: Body) async throws -> T {
    72â†’        let url = try endpoint.buildURL()
    73â†’        var request = URLRequest(url: url)
    74â†’        request.httpMethod = endpoint.method.rawValue
    75â†’        request.setValue("application/json", forHTTPHeaderField: "Content-Type")
    76â†’
    77â†’        if let token = await getActiveToken() {
    78â†’            request.setValue("Bearer \(token)", forHTTPHeaderField: "Authorization")
    79â†’        }
    80â†’
    81â†’        request.httpBody = try encoder.encode(body)
    82â†’
    83â†’        #if DEBUG
    84â†’        print("ðŸŒ API Request: \(endpoint.method.rawValue) \(url.absoluteString)")
    85â†’        if let bodyData = request.httpBody,
    86â†’           let bodyString = String(data: bodyData, encoding: .utf8) {
    87â†’            print("ðŸ“¤ Request Body: \(bodyString)")
    88â†’        }
    89â†’        #endif
    90â†’
    91â†’        return try await performRequest(request)
    92â†’    }
    93â†’
    94â†’    func uploadWithoutResponse<Body: Encodable>(_ endpoint: APIEndpoint, body: Body) async throws {
    95â†’        let url = try endpoint.buildURL()
    96â†’        var request = URLRequest(url: url)
    97â†’        request.httpMethod = endpoint.method.rawValue
    98â†’        request.setValue("application/json", forHTTPHeaderField: "Content-Type")
    99â†’
   100â†’        if let token = await getActiveToken() {
   101â†’            request.setValue("Bearer \(token)", forHTTPHeaderField: "Authorization")
   102â†’        }
   103â†’
   104â†’        request.httpBody = try encoder.encode(body)
   105â†’
   106â†’        #if DEBUG
   107â†’        print("ðŸŒ API Request: \(endpoint.method.rawValue) \(url.absoluteString)")
   108â†’        #endif
   109â†’
   110â†’        let (_, response) = try await session.data(for: request)
   111â†’        try validateResponse(response)
   112â†’    }
   113â†’
   114â†’    // MARK: - Private Methods
   115â†’    private func performRequest<T: Decodable>(_ request: URLRequest) async throws -> T {
   116â†’        let (data, response) = try await session.data(for: request)
   117â†’
   118â†’        try validateResponse(response)
   119â†’
   120â†’        #if DEBUG
   121â†’        if let responseString = String(data: data, encoding: .utf8) {
   122â†’            print("ðŸ“¥ Response: \(responseString.prefix(500))")
   123â†’        }
   124â†’        #endif
   125â†’
   126â†’        do {
   127â†’            let decoded = try decoder.decode(T.self, from: data)
   128â†’            return decoded
   129â†’        } catch {
   130â†’            #if DEBUG
   131â†’            print("âŒ Decoding Error: \(error)")
   132â†’            #endif
   133â†’            throw APIError.decodingError(error)
   134â†’        }
   135â†’    }
   136â†’
   137â†’    private func validateResponse(_ response: URLResponse) throws {
   138â†’        guard let httpResponse = response as? HTTPURLResponse else {
   139â†’            throw APIError.invalidResponse
   140â†’        }
   141â†’
   142â†’        #if DEBUG
   143â†’        print("ðŸ“Š Status Code: \(httpResponse.statusCode)")
   144â†’
   145â†’        // Log Clerk-specific headers for debugging auth issues
   146â†’        if let clerkAuthStatus = httpResponse.value(forHTTPHeaderField: "x-clerk-auth-status") {
   147â†’            print("ðŸ” Clerk Auth Status: \(clerkAuthStatus)")
   148â†’        }
   149â†’        if let clerkAuthReason = httpResponse.value(forHTTPHeaderField: "x-clerk-auth-reason") {
   150â†’            print("ðŸ” Clerk Auth Reason: \(clerkAuthReason)")
   151â†’        }
   152â†’        if let clerkAuthMessage = httpResponse.value(forHTTPHeaderField: "x-clerk-auth-message") {
   153â†’            print("ðŸ” Clerk Auth Message: \(clerkAuthMessage)")
   154â†’        }
   155â†’        #endif
   156â†’
   157â†’        switch httpResponse.statusCode {
   158â†’        case 200...299:
   159â†’            return
   160â†’        case 401:
   161â†’            throw APIError.unauthorized
   162â†’        case 403:
   163â†’            throw APIError.forbidden
   164â†’        case 404:
   165â†’            #if DEBUG
   166â†’            print("âŒ 404 Not Found - Endpoint may not exist or auth failed")
   167â†’            #endif
   168â†’            throw APIError.notFound
   169â†’        case 429:
   170â†’            throw APIError.rateLimited
   171â†’        case 500...599:
   172â†’            throw APIError.serverError(statusCode: httpResponse.statusCode)
   173â†’        default:
   174â†’            throw APIError.serverError(statusCode: httpResponse.statusCode)
   175â†’        }
   176â†’    }
   177â†’
   178â†’    // MARK: - Retry Logic
   179â†’    func requestWithRetry<T: Decodable>(
   180â†’        _ endpoint: APIEndpoint,
   181â†’        maxRetries: Int = 3,
   182â†’        retryDelay: TimeInterval = 1.0
   183â†’    ) async throws -> T {
   184â†’        var lastError: APIError?
   185â†’
   186â†’        for attempt in 0..<maxRetries {
   187â†’            do {
   188â†’                return try await request(endpoint)
   189â†’            } catch let error as APIError {
   190â†’                lastError = error
   191â†’
   192â†’                guard error.isRetryable && attempt < maxRetries - 1 else {
   193â†’                    throw error
   194â†’                }
   195â†’
   196â†’                let delay = retryDelay * pow(2.0, Double(attempt))
   197â†’                #if DEBUG
   198â†’                print("â³ Retry attempt \(attempt + 1) after \(delay)s")
   199â†’                #endif
   200â†’
   201â†’                try await Task.sleep(nanoseconds: UInt64(delay * 1_000_000_000))
   202â†’            }
   203â†’        }
   204â†’
   205â†’        throw lastError ?? APIError.unknown
   206â†’    }
   207â†’}
   208â†’

1â†’import Foundation
     2â†’
     3â†’// MARK: - HTTPMethod
     4â†’enum HTTPMethod: String {
     5â†’    case get = "GET"
     6â†’    case post = "POST"
     7â†’    case put = "PUT"
     8â†’    case patch = "PATCH"
     9â†’    case delete = "DELETE"
    10â†’}
    11â†’
    12â†’// MARK: - APIEndpoint
    13â†’enum APIEndpoint {
    14â†’    // Auth endpoints
    15â†’    case getUserProfile
    16â†’
    17â†’    // Stock endpoints
    18â†’    case stockDetail(symbol: String)
    19â†’    case stockSearch(query: String)
    20â†’    case exchangeRate
    21â†’
    22â†’    // Portfolio endpoints
    23â†’    case portfolio
    24â†’    case savePortfolio
    25â†’    case addStock
    26â†’    case updateStock(symbol: String)
    27â†’    case deleteStock(symbol: String)
    28â†’
    29â†’    // News endpoints
    30â†’    case news(symbol: String, count: Int, refresh: Int)
    31â†’    case summarizeNews
    32â†’
    33â†’    // Preferences endpoints
    34â†’    case preferences
    35â†’    case updatePreferences
    36â†’
    37â†’    // Subscription endpoints
    38â†’    case validateReceipt
    39â†’
    40â†’    var baseURL: String {
    41â†’        return Constants.API.baseURL
    42â†’    }
    43â†’
    44â†’    var path: String {
    45â†’        switch self {
    46â†’        case .getUserProfile:
    47â†’            return "/api/user/profile"
    48â†’        case .stockDetail(let symbol):
    49â†’            return "/api/stocks/\(symbol)"
    50â†’        case .stockSearch:
    51â†’            return "/api/stocks/search"
    52â†’        case .exchangeRate:
    53â†’            return "/api/exchange-rate"
    54â†’        case .portfolio, .savePortfolio, .addStock:
    55â†’            return "/api/portfolio"
    56â†’        case .updateStock(let symbol), .deleteStock(let symbol):
    57â†’            return "/api/portfolio/\(symbol)"
    58â†’        case .news(let symbol, _, _):
    59â†’            return "/api/news/\(symbol)"
    60â†’        case .summarizeNews:
    61â†’            return "/api/news/summarize"
    62â†’        case .preferences, .updatePreferences:
    63â†’            return "/api/preferences"
    64â†’        case .validateReceipt:
    65â†’            return "/api/subscriptions/validate-ios-receipt"
    66â†’        }
    67â†’    }
    68â†’
    69â†’    var method: HTTPMethod {
    70â†’        switch self {
    71â†’        case .getUserProfile, .stockDetail, .stockSearch, .exchangeRate, .portfolio, .news, .preferences:
    72â†’            return .get
    73â†’        case .savePortfolio, .addStock, .summarizeNews, .validateReceipt:
    74â†’            return .post
    75â†’        case .updatePreferences, .updateStock:

    77â†’        case .deleteStock:

    79â†’        }
    80â†’    }
    81â†’
    82â†’    var queryItems: [URLQueryItem]? {

1â†’import Foundation
     2â†’
     3â†’// MARK: - APIError
     4â†’enum APIError: LocalizedError {
     5â†’    case invalidURL
     6â†’    case invalidResponse
     7â†’    case unauthorized
     8â†’    case forbidden
     9â†’    case notFound
    10â†’    case serverError(statusCode: Int)
    11â†’    case decodingError(Error)
    12â†’    case networkError(Error)
    13â†’    case noData
    14â†’    case rateLimited
    15â†’    case unknown
    16â†’
    17â†’    var errorDescription: String? {
    18â†’        switch self {
    19â†’        case .invalidURL:
    20â†’            return "Invalid URL"
    21â†’        case .invalidResponse:
    22â†’            return "Invalid response from server"
    23â†’        case .unauthorized:
    24â†’            return "Authentication required"
    25â†’        case .forbidden:
    26â†’            return "Access forbidden"
    27â†’        case .notFound:
    28â†’            return "Resource not found"
    29â†’        case .serverError(let statusCode):
    30â†’            return "Server error (Status: \(statusCode))"
    31â†’        case .decodingError(let error):
    32â†’            return "Failed to decode response: \(error.localizedDescription)"
    33â†’        case .networkError(let error):
    34â†’            return "Network error: \(error.localizedDescription)"
    35â†’        case .noData:
    36â†’            return "No data received"
    37â†’        case .rateLimited:
    38â†’            return "Too many requests. Please try again later."
    39â†’        case .unknown:
    40â†’            return "An unknown error occurred"
    41â†’        }
    42â†’    }
    43â†’
    44â†’    var recoverySuggestion: String? {
    45â†’        switch self {
    46â†’        case .unauthorized:
    47â†’            return "Please sign in again"
    48â†’        case .networkError:
    49â†’            return "Check your internet connection and try again"
    50â†’        case .rateLimited:
    51â†’            return "Wait a moment before trying again"
    52â†’        case .serverError:
    53â†’            return "Try again later or contact support"
    54â†’        default:
    55â†’            return nil
    56â†’        }
    57â†’    }
    58â†’
    59â†’    var isRetryable: Bool {
    60â†’        switch self {
    61â†’        case .networkError, .serverError, .rateLimited:
    62â†’            return true
    63â†’        default:
    64â†’            return false
    65â†’        }
    66â†’    }
    67â†’}
    68â†’
    69â†’// MARK: - APIResult
    70â†’typealias APIResult<T> = Result<T, APIError>
    71â†’

   374â†’        XCTAssertEqual(decoded.type, .updateStock)
   375â†’        XCTAssertEqual(decoded.stock?.symbol, "TSLA")
   376â†’    }
   377â†’}

1â†’import Foundation
     2â†’import Combine
     3â†’
     4â†’// MARK: - StockService
     5â†’/// Service for fetching stock data from API
     6â†’@MainActor
     7â†’class StockService: ObservableObject {
     8â†’    static let shared = StockService()
     9â†’
    10â†’    private let apiClient = APIClient.shared
    11â†’    private var searchCancellable: AnyCancellable?
    12â†’
    13â†’    @Published var isLoading = false
    14â†’    @Published var error: Error?
    15â†’
    16â†’    private init() {}
    17â†’
    18â†’    // MARK: - Stock Detail
    19â†’
    20â†’    /// Fetch detailed stock information
    21â†’    func fetchStockDetail(symbol: String) async throws -> Stock {
    22â†’        isLoading = true
    23â†’        defer { isLoading = false }
    24â†’
    25â†’        do {
    26â†’            let response: StockDetailResponse = try await apiClient.request(.stockDetail(symbol: symbol))
    27â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.info("Fetched stock detail for \(symbol)")
    28â†’            return response.toStock(defaultSymbol: symbol, defaultName: symbol)
    29â†’        } catch {
    30â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.error("Failed to fetch stock detail: \(error.localizedDescription)")
    31â†’
    32â†’            // If API fails, create a basic stock with the symbol
    33â†’            // This allows adding stocks even if the detail endpoint fails
    34â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.warning("Creating basic stock for \(symbol) due to API error")
    35â†’            return Stock(
    36â†’                symbol: symbol,
    37â†’                name: symbol,
    38â†’                lots: [],
    39â†’                currency: "USD"
    40â†’            )
    41â†’        }
    42â†’    }
    43â†’
    44â†’    // MARK: - Stock Search
    45â†’
    46â†’    /// Search for stocks by query string
    47â†’    func searchStocks(query: String) async throws -> [StockSearchResult] {
    48â†’        guard !query.isEmpty else {
    49â†’            return []
    50â†’        }
    51â†’
    52â†’        do {
    53â†’            // API returns array directly, not wrapped in response object
    54â†’            let results: [StockSearchResult] = try await apiClient.request(.stockSearch(query: query))
    55â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.debug("Found \(results.count) stocks for query: \(query)")
    56â†’            return results
    57â†’        } catch {
    58â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.error("Stock search failed: \(error.localizedDescription)")
    59â†’            self.error = error
    60â†’            throw error
    61â†’        }
    62â†’    }
    63â†’
    64â†’    /// Search with debouncing (call this from UI with reactive binding)
    65â†’    func debouncedSearch(query: String, delay: TimeInterval = 0.3) -> AnyPublisher<[StockSearchResult], Never> {
    66â†’        Just(query)
    67â†’            .delay(for: .seconds(delay), scheduler: DispatchQueue.main)
    68â†’            .flatMap { [weak self] searchQuery -> AnyPublisher<[StockSearchResult], Never> in
    69â†’                guard let self = self, !searchQuery.isEmpty else {
    70â†’                    return Just([]).eraseToAnyPublisher()
    71â†’                }
    72â†’
    73â†’                return Future { promise in
    74â†’                    Task {
    75â†’                        do {
    76â†’                            let results = try await self.searchStocks(query: searchQuery)
    77â†’                            promise(.success(results))
    78â†’                        } catch {
    79â†’                            promise(.success([]))
    80â†’                        }
    81â†’                    }
    82â†’                }
    83â†’                .eraseToAnyPublisher()
    84â†’            }
    85â†’            .eraseToAnyPublisher()
    86â†’    }
    87â†’
    88â†’    // MARK: - Price Updates
    89â†’
    90â†’    /// Refresh current prices for multiple stocks
    91â†’    func refreshPrices(for symbols: [String]) async throws -> [String: StockPrice] {
    92â†’        isLoading = true
    93â†’        defer { isLoading = false }
    94â†’
    95â†’        var prices: [String: StockPrice] = [:]
    96â†’
    97â†’        // Fetch prices concurrently
    98â†’        try await withThrowingTaskGroup(of: (String, StockPrice).self) { group in
    99â†’            for symbol in symbols {
   100â†’                group.addTask {
   101â†’                    let stock = try await self.fetchStockDetail(symbol: symbol)
   102â†’                    let price = StockPrice(
   103â†’                        symbol: symbol,
   104â†’                        currentPrice: stock.currentPrice ?? 0,
   105â†’                        previousClose: stock.previousClose ?? 0,
   106â†’                        lastUpdated: Date()
   107â†’                    )
   108â†’                    return (symbol, price)
   109â†’                }
   110â†’            }
   111â†’
   112â†’            for try await (symbol, price) in group {
   113â†’                prices[symbol] = price
   114â†’            }
   115â†’        }
   116â†’
   117â†’        AppLogger.portfolio.info("Refreshed prices for \(prices.count) stocks")
   118â†’        return prices
   119â†’    }
   120â†’
   121â†’    /// Refresh price for a single stock
   122â†’    func refreshPrice(for symbol: String) async throws -> StockPrice {
   123â†’        let stock = try await fetchStockDetail(symbol: symbol)
   124â†’        return StockPrice(
   125â†’            symbol: symbol,
   126â†’            currentPrice: stock.currentPrice ?? 0,
   127â†’            previousClose: stock.previousClose ?? 0,
   128â†’            lastUpdated: Date()
   129â†’        )
   130â†’    }
   131â†’
   132â†’    // MARK: - Historical Data
   133â†’
   134â†’    /// Fetch historical price data from the stock detail endpoint
   135â†’    func fetchHistoricalData(symbol: String, range: TimeRange) async throws -> [HistoricalDataPoint] {
   136â†’        do {
   137â†’            let response: StockDetailWithHistoryResponse = try await apiClient.request(
   138â†’                .stockDetail(symbol: symbol)
   139â†’            )
   140â†’
   141â†’            let dateFormatter = DateFormatter()
   142â†’            dateFormatter.dateFormat = "yyyy-MM-dd"
   143â†’            dateFormatter.locale = Locale(identifier: "en_US_POSIX")
   144â†’
   145â†’            let cutoffDate = Calendar.current.date(
   146â†’                byAdding: .day, value: -range.days, to: Date()
   147â†’            ) ?? Date()
   148â†’
   149â†’            let points = (response.history ?? []).compactMap { item -> HistoricalDataPoint? in
   150â†’                guard let date = dateFormatter.date(from: item.date) else {
   151â†’                    return nil
   152â†’                }
   153â†’                guard date >= cutoffDate else { return nil }
   154â†’                return HistoricalDataPoint(
   155â†’                    date: date,
   156â†’                    open: item.price,
   157â†’                    high: item.price,
   158â†’                    low: item.price,
   159â†’                    close: item.price,
   160â†’                    volume: 0
   161â†’                )
   162â†’            }
   163â†’
   164â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.info("Fetched \(points.count) historical data points for \(symbol) (range: \(range.rawValue))")
   165â†’            return points
   166â†’        } catch {
   167â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.error("Failed to fetch historical data for \(symbol): \(error.localizedDescription)")
   168â†’            throw error
   169â†’        }
   170â†’    }
   171â†’
   172â†’    // MARK: - Batch Operations
   173â†’
   174â†’    /// Fetch details for multiple stocks
   175â†’    func fetchStocks(symbols: [String]) async throws -> [Stock] {
   176â†’        var stocks: [Stock] = []
   177â†’
   178â†’        try await withThrowingTaskGroup(of: Stock.self) { group in
   179â†’            for symbol in symbols {
   180â†’                group.addTask {
   181â†’                    try await self.fetchStockDetail(symbol: symbol)
   182â†’                }
   183â†’            }
   184â†’
   185â†’            for try await stock in group {
   186â†’                stocks.append(stock)
   187â†’            }
   188â†’        }
   189â†’
   190â†’        AppLogger.portfolio.info("Fetched \(stocks.count) stocks")
   191â†’        return stocks
   192â†’    }
   193â†’}
   194â†’
   195â†’// MARK: - Supporting Models
   196â†’
   197â†’/// Stock price information
   198â†’struct StockPrice: Codable {
   199â†’    let symbol: String
   200â†’    let currentPrice: Double
   201â†’    let previousClose: Double
   202â†’    let lastUpdated: Date
   203â†’
   204â†’    var change: Double {
   205â†’        currentPrice - previousClose
   206â†’    }
   207â†’
   208â†’    var changePercent: Double {
   209â†’        guard previousClose > 0 else { return 0 }
   210â†’        return (change / previousClose) * 100
   211â†’    }
   212â†’}
   213â†’
   214â†’/// API Response models
   215â†’private struct StockDetailResponse: Codable {
   216â†’    let symbol: String?
   217â†’    let name: String?
   218â†’    let currency: String?
   219â†’    let currentPrice: Double?
   220â†’    let previousClose: Double?
   221â†’    let exchange: String?
   222â†’    let marketCap: Double?
   223â†’    let price: Double? // Alternative field name
   224â†’    let close: Double? // Alternative field name
   225â†’
   226â†’    // Support alternative field names
   227â†’    enum CodingKeys: String, CodingKey {
   228â†’        case symbol
   229â†’        case name
   230â†’        case currency
   231â†’        case currentPrice
   232â†’        case previousClose
   233â†’        case exchange
   234â†’        case marketCap
   235â†’        case price
   236â†’        case close
   237â†’    }
   238â†’
   239â†’    func toStock(defaultSymbol: String, defaultName: String) -> Stock {
   240â†’        Stock(
   241â†’            id: UUID().uuidString,
   242â†’            symbol: symbol ?? defaultSymbol,
   243â†’            name: name ?? defaultName,
   244â†’            lots: [],
   245â†’            currentPrice: currentPrice ?? price,
   246â†’            previousClose: previousClose ?? close,
   247â†’            currency: currency ?? "USD",
   248â†’            lastUpdated: Date()
   249â†’        )
   250â†’    }
   251â†’}
   252â†’
   253â†’// StockSearchResponse removed - API returns array directly
   254â†’
   255â†’/// Response from stock detail endpoint that includes history

1â†’import Foundation
     2â†’import Combine
     3â†’
     4â†’// MARK: - ExchangeRateService
     5â†’/// Service for fetching and managing currency exchange rates
     6â†’@MainActor
     7â†’class ExchangeRateService: ObservableObject {
     8â†’    static let shared = ExchangeRateService()
     9â†’
    10â†’    private let apiClient = APIClient.shared
    11â†’    private let cacheKey = "exchange_rates_cache"
    12â†’    private let cacheExpirationKey = "exchange_rates_expiration"
    13â†’
    14â†’    @Published var rates: [String: Double] = [:]
    15â†’    @Published var isLoading = false
    16â†’    @Published var error: Error?
    17â†’    @Published var lastUpdated: Date?
    18â†’
    19â†’    private init() {
    20â†’        loadCachedRates()
    21â†’    }
    22â†’
    23â†’    // MARK: - Fetch Rates
    24â†’
    25â†’    /// Fetch latest exchange rates from API
    26â†’    func fetchExchangeRates(baseCurrency: Currency = .usd) async throws {
    27â†’        // Check if cached rates are still valid
    28â†’        if let cachedRates = loadCachedRates(), !isCacheExpired() {
    29â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.debug("Using cached exchange rates")
    30â†’            return
    31â†’        }
    32â†’
    33â†’        isLoading = true
    34â†’        defer { isLoading = false }
    35â†’
    36â†’        do {
    37â†’            let response: ExchangeRateResponse = try await apiClient.request(.exchangeRate)
    38â†’
    39â†’            // API returns a single USDâ†’CAD rate. Build rates dict with USD as base.
    40â†’            let ratesDict: [String: Double] = [
    41â†’                Currency.usd.rawValue: 1.0,
    42â†’                Currency.cad.rawValue: response.rate
    43â†’            ]
    44â†’
    45â†’            self.rates = ratesDict
    46â†’            self.lastUpdated = Date()
    47â†’
    48â†’            cacheRates(ratesDict)
    49â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.info("Fetched exchange rate: USDâ†’CAD = \(response.rate)")
    50â†’        } catch {
    51â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.error("Failed to fetch exchange rates: \(error.localizedDescription)")
    52â†’            self.error = error
    53â†’            throw error
    54â†’        }
    55â†’    }
    56â†’
    57â†’    // MARK: - Currency Conversion
    58â†’
    59â†’    /// Convert amount from one currency to another
    60â†’    func convert(amount: Double, from: Currency, to: Currency) async throws -> Double {
    61â†’        // If same currency, no conversion needed
    62â†’        if from == to {
    63â†’            return amount
    64â†’        }
    65â†’
    66â†’        // Ensure we have fresh rates
    67â†’        if rates.isEmpty || isCacheExpired() {
    68â†’            try await fetchExchangeRates()
    69â†’        }
    70â†’
    71â†’        // Get exchange rate
    72â†’        guard let fromRate = getRate(for: from),
    73â†’              let toRate = getRate(for: to) else {
    74â†’            throw ExchangeRateError.rateNotAvailable
    75â†’        }
    76â†’
    77â†’        // Convert through USD as base
    78â†’        let amountInUSD = amount / fromRate
    79â†’        let convertedAmount = amountInUSD * toRate
    80â†’
    81â†’        AppLogger.portfolio.debug("Converted \(amount) \(from.rawValue) to \(convertedAmount) \(to.rawValue)")
    82â†’        return convertedAmount
    83â†’    }
    84â†’
    85â†’    /// Convert multiple amounts in bulk
    86â†’    func convertBatch(_ items: [(amount: Double, from: Currency)], to: Currency) async throws -> [Double] {
    87â†’        // Ensure we have fresh rates
    88â†’        if rates.isEmpty || isCacheExpired() {
    89â†’            try await fetchExchangeRates()
    90â†’        }
    91â†’
    92â†’        return items.map { item in
    93â†’            guard item.from != to else { return item.amount }
    94â†’
    95â†’            if let fromRate = getRate(for: item.from),
    96â†’               let toRate = getRate(for: to) {
    97â†’                let amountInUSD = item.amount / fromRate
    98â†’                return amountInUSD * toRate
    99â†’            }
   100â†’            return item.amount // Return original if conversion fails
   101â†’        }
   102â†’    }
   103â†’
   104â†’    /// Get exchange rate for a specific currency
   105â†’    func getRate(for currency: Currency) -> Double? {
   106â†’        return rates[currency.rawValue]
   107â†’    }
   108â†’
   109â†’    /// Get exchange rate between two currencies
   110â†’    func getExchangeRate(from: Currency, to: Currency) -> Double? {
   111â†’        guard from != to else { return 1.0 }
   112â†’
   113â†’        guard let fromRate = getRate(for: from),
   114â†’              let toRate = getRate(for: to) else {
   115â†’            return nil
   116â†’        }
   117â†’
   118â†’        // Calculate cross rate through USD
   119â†’        return toRate / fromRate
   120â†’    }
   121â†’
   122â†’    // MARK: - Caching
   123â†’
   124â†’    @discardableResult
   125â†’    private func loadCachedRates() -> [String: Double]? {
   126â†’        guard let data = UserDefaults.standard.data(forKey: cacheKey),
   127â†’              let cached = try? JSONDecoder().decode([String: Double].self, from: data) else {
   128â†’            return nil
   129â†’        }
   130â†’
   131â†’        self.rates = cached
   132â†’
   133â†’        if let expirationDate = UserDefaults.standard.object(forKey: cacheExpirationKey) as? Date {
   134â†’            self.lastUpdated = expirationDate
   135â†’        }
   136â†’
   137â†’        return cached
   138â†’    }
   139â†’
   140â†’    private func cacheRates(_ rates: [String: Double]) {
   141â†’        if let data = try? JSONEncoder().encode(rates) {
   142â†’            UserDefaults.standard.set(data, forKey: cacheKey)
   143â†’
   144â†’            let expirationDate = Date().addingTimeInterval(Constants.Cache.priceCacheDuration)
   145â†’            UserDefaults.standard.set(expirationDate, forKey: cacheExpirationKey)
   146â†’        }
   147â†’    }
   148â†’
   149â†’    private func isCacheExpired() -> Bool {
   150â†’        guard let expirationDate = UserDefaults.standard.object(forKey: cacheExpirationKey) as? Date else {
   151â†’            return true
   152â†’        }
   153â†’        return Date() > expirationDate
   154â†’    }
   155â†’
   156â†’    /// Clear cached rates (force refresh on next request)
   157â†’    func clearCache() {
   158â†’        UserDefaults.standard.removeObject(forKey: cacheKey)
   159â†’        UserDefaults.standard.removeObject(forKey: cacheExpirationKey)
   160â†’        rates = [:]
   161â†’        lastUpdated = nil
   162â†’        AppLogger.portfolio.debug("Cleared exchange rate cache")
   163â†’    }
   164â†’
   165â†’    // MARK: - Helpers
   166â†’
   167â†’    /// Format amount in target currency
   168â†’    func formatAmount(_ amount: Double, in currency: Currency, locale: Locale = .current) -> String {
   169â†’        let formatter = NumberFormatter()
   170â†’        formatter.numberStyle = .currency
   171â†’        formatter.currencyCode = currency.rawValue
   172â†’        formatter.locale = locale
   173â†’        return formatter.string(from: NSNumber(value: amount)) ?? "\(amount)"
   174â†’    }
   175â†’
   176â†’    /// Get currency symbol
   177â†’    func getSymbol(for currencyCode: String) -> String {
   178â†’        let locale = Locale(identifier: "en_US")
   179â†’        let formatter = NumberFormatter()
   180â†’        formatter.numberStyle = .currency
   181â†’        formatter.currencyCode = currencyCode
   182â†’        formatter.locale = locale
   183â†’        return formatter.currencySymbol ?? currencyCode
   184â†’    }
   185â†’}
   186â†’
   187â†’// MARK: - Exchange Rate Response
   188â†’
   189â†’private struct ExchangeRateResponse: Codable {
   190â†’    let rate: Double
   191â†’}
   192â†’
   193â†’// MARK: - ExchangeRateError
   194â†’
   195â†’enum ExchangeRateError: LocalizedError {
   196â†’    case rateNotAvailable
   197â†’    case conversionFailed
   198â†’    case cacheExpired
   199â†’
   200â†’    var errorDescription: String? {
   201â†’        switch self {
   202â†’        case .rateNotAvailable:
   203â†’            return "Exchange rate not available for the requested currency"
   204â†’        case .conversionFailed:
   205â†’            return "Currency conversion failed"
   206â†’        case .cacheExpired:
   207â†’            return "Exchange rate cache has expired"
   208â†’        }
   209â†’    }
   210â†’}
   211â†’

1â†’import Foundation
     2â†’import Combine
     3â†’
     4â†’// MARK: - NewsService
     5â†’@MainActor
     6â†’class NewsService: ObservableObject {
     7â†’    static let shared = NewsService()
     8â†’
     9â†’    private let apiClient = APIClient.shared
    10â†’    private let cacheKey = "cached_news"
    11â†’
    12â†’    @Published var isLoading = false
    13â†’    @Published var error: Error?
    14â†’
    15â†’    // In-memory cache for quick access
    16â†’    private var memoryCache: [String: CachedNews] = [:]
    17â†’
    18â†’    private init() {
    19â†’        loadCacheFromDisk()
    20â†’    }
    21â†’
    22â†’    // MARK: - Fetch News
    23â†’
    24â†’    /// Fetch news articles for a stock symbol with caching
    25â†’    func fetchNews(for symbol: String, count: Int = 10, forceRefresh: Bool = false) async throws -> NewsResponse {
    26â†’        isLoading = true
    27â†’        defer { isLoading = false }
    28â†’
    29â†’        // 1. Check cache first (unless force refresh)
    30â†’        if !forceRefresh, let cached = getCachedNews(for: symbol), !cached.isExpired {
    31â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.debug("Using cached news for \(symbol)")
    32â†’            return NewsResponse(articles: cached.articles, hasSentiment: cached.hasSentiment)
    33â†’        }
    34â†’
    35â†’        do {
    36â†’            // 2. Fetch from API
    37â†’            let refresh = forceRefresh ? 1 : 0
    38â†’            let response: NewsResponse = try await apiClient.request(.news(symbol: symbol, count: count, refresh: refresh))
    39â†’
    40â†’            // 3. Cache the response
    41â†’            cacheNews(response.articles, hasSentiment: response.hasSentiment, for: symbol)
    42â†’
    43â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.info("Fetched \(response.articles.count) news articles for \(symbol), hasSentiment: \(response.hasSentiment)")
    44â†’            return response
    45â†’        } catch {
    46â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.error("Failed to fetch news for \(symbol): \(error.localizedDescription)")
    47â†’
    48â†’            // 4. Return cached data even if expired (offline fallback)
    49â†’            if let cached = getCachedNews(for: symbol) {
    50â†’                AppLogger.portfolio.warning("Using expired cache for \(symbol) due to API error")
    51â†’                return NewsResponse(articles: cached.articles, hasSentiment: cached.hasSentiment)
    52â†’            }
    53â†’
    54â†’            self.error = error
    55â†’            throw error
    56â†’        }
    57â†’    }
    58â†’
    59â†’    // MARK: - Summarize Article
    60â†’
    61â†’    /// Get AI-generated summary for a news article
    62â†’    func summarizeArticle(_ article: NewsArticle) async throws -> String {
    63â†’        isLoading = true
    64â†’        defer { isLoading = false }
    65â†’
    66â†’        do {
    67â†’            let request = NewsSummaryRequest(
    68â†’                articleUrl: article.url,
    69â†’                articleTitle: article.title,
    70â†’                source: article.source
    71â†’            )
    72â†’            let response: NewsSummaryResponse = try await apiClient.upload(
    73â†’                .summarizeNews,
    74â†’                body: request
    75â†’            )
    76â†’
    77â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.info("Generated summary for article: \(article.url)")
    78â†’            return response.summary
    79â†’        } catch {
    80â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.error("Failed to summarize article: \(error.localizedDescription)")
    81â†’            self.error = error
    82â†’            throw error
    83â†’        }
    84â†’    }
    85â†’
    86â†’    // MARK: - Cache Management
    87â†’
    88â†’    /// Get cached news for a symbol
    89â†’    private func getCachedNews(for symbol: String) -> CachedNews? {
    90â†’        return memoryCache[symbol.uppercased()]
    91â†’    }
    92â†’
    93â†’    /// Cache news articles for a symbol
    94â†’    private func cacheNews(_ articles: [NewsArticle], hasSentiment: Bool = false, for symbol: String) {
    95â†’        let cached = CachedNews(articles: articles, symbol: symbol.uppercased(), hasSentiment: hasSentiment)
    96â†’        memoryCache[symbol.uppercased()] = cached
    97â†’        saveCacheToDisk()
    98â†’    }
    99â†’
   100â†’    /// Clear cache for a specific symbol
   101â†’    func clearCache(for symbol: String) {
   102â†’        memoryCache.removeValue(forKey: symbol.uppercased())
   103â†’        saveCacheToDisk()
   104â†’        AppLogger.portfolio.debug("Cleared news cache for \(symbol)")
   105â†’    }
   106â†’
   107â†’    /// Clear all news cache
   108â†’    func clearAllCache() {
   109â†’        memoryCache.removeAll()
   110â†’        saveCacheToDisk()
   111â†’        AppLogger.portfolio.info("Cleared all news cache")
   112â†’    }
   113â†’
   114â†’    /// Check if news is cached and fresh for a symbol
   115â†’    func hasFreshCache(for symbol: String) -> Bool {
   116â†’        guard let cached = getCachedNews(for: symbol) else {
   117â†’            return false
   118â†’        }
   119â†’        return !cached.isExpired
   120â†’    }
   121â†’
   122â†’    // MARK: - Disk Persistence
   123â†’
   124â†’    private var cacheURL: URL {
   125â†’        let documentsPath = FileManager.default.urls(for: .documentDirectory, in: .userDomainMask)[0]
   126â†’        return documentsPath.appendingPathComponent("\(cacheKey).json")
   127â†’    }
   128â†’
   129â†’    /// Load cache from disk on initialization
   130â†’    private func loadCacheFromDisk() {
   131â†’        guard FileManager.default.fileExists(atPath: cacheURL.path) else {
   132â†’            return
   133â†’        }
   134â†’
   135â†’        do {
   136â†’            let data = try Data(contentsOf: cacheURL)
   137â†’            let decoder = JSONDecoder()
   138â†’            decoder.dateDecodingStrategy = .iso8601
   139â†’
   140â†’            let cacheArray = try decoder.decode([CachedNews].self, from: data)
   141â†’
   142â†’            // Convert array to dictionary for quick lookup
   143â†’            memoryCache = Dictionary(uniqueKeysWithValues: cacheArray.map { ($0.symbol, $0) })
   144â†’
   145â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.debug("Loaded news cache from disk: \(memoryCache.count) symbols")
   146â†’        } catch {
   147â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.warning("Failed to load news cache: \(error.localizedDescription)")
   148â†’        }
   149â†’    }
   150â†’
   151â†’    /// Save cache to disk
   152â†’    private func saveCacheToDisk() {
   153â†’        do {
   154â†’            let encoder = JSONEncoder()
   155â†’            encoder.dateEncodingStrategy = .iso8601
   156â†’            encoder.outputFormatting = .prettyPrinted
   157â†’
   158â†’            let cacheArray = Array(memoryCache.values)
   159â†’            let data = try encoder.encode(cacheArray)
   160â†’
   161â†’            try data.write(to: cacheURL)
   162â†’
   163â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.debug("Saved news cache to disk: \(cacheArray.count) symbols")
   164â†’        } catch {
   165â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.error("Failed to save news cache: \(error.localizedDescription)")
   166â†’        }
   167â†’    }
   168â†’
   169â†’    // MARK: - Batch Operations
   170â†’
   171â†’    /// Fetch news for multiple symbols in parallel
   172â†’    func fetchNewsForSymbols(_ symbols: [String], count: Int = 5) async throws -> [String: [NewsArticle]] {
   173â†’        isLoading = true
   174â†’        defer { isLoading = false }
   175â†’
   176â†’        var results: [String: [NewsArticle]] = [:]
   177â†’
   178â†’        try await withThrowingTaskGroup(of: (String, [NewsArticle]).self) { group in
   179â†’            for symbol in symbols {
   180â†’                group.addTask {
   181â†’                    let response = try await self.fetchNews(for: symbol, count: count)
   182â†’                    return (symbol, response.articles)
   183â†’                }
   184â†’            }
   185â†’
   186â†’            for try await (symbol, articles) in group {
   187â†’                results[symbol] = articles
   188â†’            }
   189â†’        }
   190â†’
   191â†’        AppLogger.portfolio.info("Fetched news for \(results.count) symbols")
   192â†’        return results
   193â†’    }
   194â†’
   195â†’    // MARK: - Utility Methods
   196â†’
   197â†’    /// Get cache statistics
   198â†’    func getCacheStats() -> CacheStats {
   199â†’        let totalSymbols = memoryCache.count
   200â†’        let freshSymbols = memoryCache.values.filter { !$0.isExpired }.count
   201â†’        let expiredSymbols = totalSymbols - freshSymbols
   202â†’        let totalArticles = memoryCache.values.reduce(0) { $0 + $1.articles.count }
   203â†’
   204â†’        return CacheStats(
   205â†’            totalSymbols: totalSymbols,
   206â†’            freshSymbols: freshSymbols,
   207â†’            expiredSymbols: expiredSymbols,
   208â†’            totalArticles: totalArticles
   209â†’        )
   210â†’    }
   211â†’
   212â†’    /// Get most recent cached symbols
   213â†’    func getRecentCachedSymbols(limit: Int = 10) -> [String] {
   214â†’        Array(memoryCache.values
   215â†’            .sorted { $0.cachedAt > $1.cachedAt }
   216â†’            .prefix(limit)
   217â†’            .map { $0.symbol })
   218â†’    }
   219â†’}
   220â†’
   221â†’// MARK: - CacheStats
   222â†’struct CacheStats {
   223â†’    let totalSymbols: Int
   224â†’    let freshSymbols: Int
   225â†’    let expiredSymbols: Int
   226â†’    let totalArticles: Int
   227â†’
   228â†’    var freshPercentage: Double {
   229â†’        guard totalSymbols > 0 else { return 0 }
   230â†’        return Double(freshSymbols) / Double(totalSymbols) * 100
   231â†’    }
   232â†’}
   233â†’
   234â†’// MARK: - NewsError
   235â†’enum NewsError: LocalizedError {
   236â†’    case noArticlesFound
   237â†’    case invalidURL
   238â†’    case summarizationFailed
   239â†’
   240â†’    var errorDescription: String? {
   241â†’        switch self {
   242â†’        case .noArticlesFound:
   243â†’            return "No news articles found for this stock"
   244â†’        case .invalidURL:
   245â†’            return "Invalid article URL"
   246â†’        case .summarizationFailed:
   247â†’            return "Failed to generate article summary"
   248â†’        }
   249â†’    }
   250â†’}
   251â†’

     7â†’// MARK: - PortfolioService
     8â†’@MainActor
     9â†’class PortfolioService: ObservableObject {
    10â†’    static let shared = PortfolioService()
    11â†’
    12â†’    private let repository = PortfolioRepository.shared
    13â†’    private let stockService = StockService.shared
    14â†’    private let exchangeRateService = ExchangeRateService.shared
    15â†’    private let apiClient = APIClient.shared
    16â†’    private let subscriptionManager = SubscriptionManager.shared
    17â†’
    18â†’    @Published var isLoading = false
    19â†’    @Published var error: Error?
    20â†’
    21â†’    private init() {}
    22â†’
    23â†’    // MARK: - Load Portfolio
    24â†’
    25â†’    /// Load portfolio with API-first approach (API is source of truth)
    26â†’    func loadPortfolio() async throws -> Portfolio {
    27â†’        isLoading = true
    28â†’        defer { isLoading = false }
    29â†’
    30â†’        do {
    31â†’            // 1. Try to load from API first (source of truth)
    32â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.info("Loading portfolio from API...")
    33â†’            let apiPortfolio: Portfolio = try await apiClient.request(.portfolio)
    34â†’
    35â†’            // 2. Apply backend subscription tier if present
    36â†’            if let tier = apiPortfolio.tier {
    37â†’                subscriptionManager.applyBackendTier(tier)
    38â†’            }
    39â†’
    40â†’            // 3. Save API data to Core Data (cache for offline)
    41â†’            try repository.saveStocks(apiPortfolio.stocks)
    42â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.info("âœ… Loaded \(apiPortfolio.stocks.count) stocks from API")
    43â†’
    44â†’            return apiPortfolio
    45â†’
    46â†’        } catch {
    47â†’            // 3. Fallback to Core Data if API fails (offline mode)
    48â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.warning("âš ï¸ API failed, loading from cache: \(error.localizedDescription)")
    49â†’
    50â†’            do {
    51â†’                let cachedStocks = try repository.fetchAllStocks()
    52â†’                AppLogger.portfolio.info("ðŸ“¦ Using cached data: \(cachedStocks.count) stocks")
    53â†’                return Portfolio(stocks: cachedStocks)
    54â†’            } catch {
    55â†’                AppLogger.portfolio.error("âŒ Failed to load from both API and cache")
    56â†’                self.error = error
    57â†’                throw error
    58â†’            }
    59â†’        }
    60â†’    }
    61â†’
    62â†’    // MARK: - Save Portfolio
    63â†’
    64â†’    /// Save entire portfolio (API-first) - used for bulk operations
    65â†’    func savePortfolio(_ portfolio: Portfolio) async throws {
    66â†’        isLoading = true
    67â†’        defer { isLoading = false }
    68â†’
    69â†’        do {
    70â†’            // 1. Save to API first (source of truth)
    71â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.info("Saving entire portfolio to API...")
    72â†’            let _: Portfolio = try await apiClient.upload(.savePortfolio, body: portfolio)
    73â†’
    74â†’            // 2. Save to Core Data (local cache)
    75â†’            try repository.saveStocks(portfolio.stocks)
    76â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.info("âœ… Portfolio saved successfully")
    77â†’
    78â†’        } catch {
    79â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.error("âŒ Failed to save portfolio: \(error.localizedDescription)")
    80â†’            self.error = error
    81â†’            throw error
    82â†’        }
    83â†’    }
    84â†’
    85â†’    // MARK: - Add Stock
    86â†’
    87â†’    /// Add a new stock with lot to portfolio (API-first)
    88â†’    func addStock(_ stock: Stock) async throws {
    89â†’        isLoading = true
    90â†’        defer { isLoading = false }
    91â†’
    92â†’        do {
    93â†’            // 1. Save to API first (source of truth)
    94â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.info("Adding stock \(stock.symbol) to API...")
    95â†’            let _: Stock = try await apiClient.upload(.addStock, body: stock)
    96â†’
    97â†’            // 2. Save to Core Data (local cache)
    98â†’            try repository.saveStock(stock)
    99â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.info("âœ… Added stock: \(stock.symbol)")
   100â†’
   101â†’        } catch {
   102â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.error("âŒ Failed to add stock: \(error.localizedDescription)")
   103â†’            self.error = error
   104â†’            throw error
   105â†’        }
   106â†’    }
   107â†’
   108â†’    // MARK: - Update Stock
   109â†’
   110â†’    /// Update an existing stock (API-first)
   111â†’    func updateStock(_ stock: Stock) async throws {
   112â†’        isLoading = true
   113â†’        defer { isLoading = false }
   114â†’
   115â†’        do {
   116â†’            // 1. Update API first (source of truth)
   117â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.info("Updating stock \(stock.symbol) in API...")
   118â†’            let _: Stock = try await apiClient.upload(.updateStock(symbol: stock.symbol), body: stock)
   119â†’
   120â†’            // 2. Update Core Data (local cache)
   121â†’            try repository.saveStock(stock)
   122â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.info("âœ… Updated stock: \(stock.symbol)")
   123â†’
   124â†’        } catch {
   125â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.error("âŒ Failed to update stock: \(error.localizedDescription)")
   126â†’            self.error = error
   127â†’            throw error
   128â†’        }
   129â†’    }
   130â†’
   131â†’    // MARK: - Delete Stock
   132â†’
   133â†’    /// Delete a stock and all its lots (API-first)
   134â†’    func deleteStock(symbol: String) async throws {
   135â†’        isLoading = true
   136â†’        defer { isLoading = false }
   137â†’
   138â†’        do {
   139â†’            // 1. Delete from API first (source of truth)
   140â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.info("Deleting stock \(symbol) from API...")
   141â†’            try await apiClient.request(.deleteStock(symbol: symbol)) as EmptyResponse
   142â†’
   143â†’            // 2. Delete from Core Data (local cache)
   144â†’            try repository.deleteStock(symbol: symbol)
   145â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.info("âœ… Deleted stock: \(symbol)")
   146â†’
   147â†’        } catch {
   148â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.error("âŒ Failed to delete stock: \(error.localizedDescription)")
   149â†’            self.error = error
   150â†’            throw error
   151â†’        }
   152â†’    }
   153â†’
   154â†’    // MARK: - Refresh Prices
   155â†’
   156â†’    /// Refresh prices for all stocks in portfolio
   157â†’    func refreshPrices(for stocks: [Stock]) async throws -> [Stock] {
   158â†’        isLoading = true
   159â†’        defer { isLoading = false }
   160â†’
   161â†’        do {
   162â†’            let symbols = stocks.map { $0.symbol }
   163â†’            let prices = try await stockService.refreshPrices(for: symbols)
   164â†’
   165â†’            var updatedStocks: [Stock] = []
   166â†’
   167â†’            for stock in stocks {
   168â†’                if let price = prices[stock.symbol] {
   169â†’                    // Update stock with new price
   170â†’                    var updatedStock = stock
   171â†’                    updatedStock.currentPrice = price.currentPrice
   172â†’                    updatedStock.previousClose = price.previousClose
   173â†’                    updatedStock.lastUpdated = price.lastUpdated
   174â†’
   175â†’                    // Save to repository
   176â†’                    try repository.updateStockPrice(
   177â†’                        symbol: stock.symbol,
   178â†’                        currentPrice: price.currentPrice,
   179â†’                        previousClose: price.previousClose
   180â†’                    )
   181â†’
   182â†’                    updatedStocks.append(updatedStock)
   183â†’                } else {
   184â†’                    updatedStocks.append(stock)
   185â†’                }
   186â†’            }
   187â†’
   188â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.info("Refreshed prices for \(updatedStocks.count) stocks")
   189â†’            return updatedStocks
   190â†’        } catch {
   191â†’            AppLogger.portfolio.error("Failed to refresh prices: \(error.localizedDescription)")
   192â†’            self.error = error
   193â†’            throw error
   194â†’        }
   195â†’    }
   196â†’
   197â†’
   198â†’    // MARK: - Statistics
   199â†’
   200â†’    /// Get portfolio summary statistics
   201â†’    func getPortfolioSummary(currency: Currency = .usd) async throws -> PortfolioSummary {
   202â†’        let stocks = try repository.fetchAllStocks()
   203â†’        let portfolio = Portfolio(stocks: stocks, currency: currency)
   204â†’        return PortfolioSummary(portfolio: portfolio)
   205â†’    }
   206â†’
   207â†’    // MARK: - Currency Conversion
   208â†’
   209â†’    /// Get portfolio value in specific currency
   210â†’    func getPortfolioValue(in currency: Currency) async throws -> Double {
   211â†’        let stocks = try repository.fetchAllStocks()
   212â†’
   213â†’        // Ensure we have exchange rates
   214â†’        try await exchangeRateService.fetchExchangeRates()
   215â†’
   216â†’        var totalValue: Double = 0
   217â†’
   218â†’        for stock in stocks {
   219â†’            let stockValue = stock.lots.reduce(0) { sum, lot in
   220â†’                sum + (lot.shares * (stock.currentPrice ?? lot.pricePerShare))
   221â†’            }
   222â†’
   223â†’            // Convert if stock currency differs from target
   224â†’            if let stockCurrency = Currency(rawValue: stock.currency), stockCurrency != currency {
   225â†’                totalValue += try await exchangeRateService.convert(amount: stockValue, from: stockCurrency, to: currency)
   226â†’            } else {
   227â†’                totalValue += stockValue
   228â†’            }
   229â†’        }
   230â†’
   231â†’        return totalValue
   232â†’    }
   233â†’}
   234â†’

     2â†’@testable import EquityLabs

     4â†’final class PortfolioServiceTests: XCTestCase {
     5â†’
     6â†’    // MARK: - PortfolioService is a singleton with private init,
     7â†’    // so we test via the shared instance or test the repository layer directly.
     8â†’    // For Phase 3, we test PortfolioRepository (sync Core Data operations) thoroughly.
     9â†’
    10â†’    // MARK: - PortfolioRepository Tests (Core Data layer)
    11â†’
    12â†’    @MainActor
    13â†’    func testSaveAndFetchStock() async throws {
    14â†’        // Use PersistenceController for in-memory testing
    15â†’        // Note: Since PortfolioRepository uses shared singleton,
    16â†’        // we test the data flow patterns with model objects.
    17â†’        let stock = Stock(
    18â†’            symbol: "AAPL",
    19â†’            name: "Apple Inc.",
    20â†’            lots: [StockLot(shares: 10, pricePerShare: 150)],
    21â†’            currentPrice: 160,
    22â†’            currency: "USD"
    23â†’        )
    24â†’
    25â†’        XCTAssertEqual(stock.symbol, "AAPL")
    26â†’        XCTAssertEqual(stock.lots.count, 1)
    27â†’        XCTAssertEqual(stock.totalShares, 10)
    28â†’        XCTAssertEqual(stock.currentValue, 1600)
    29â†’    }
    30â†’
    31â†’    func testStockWithMultipleLots() {
    32â†’        let stock = Stock(
    33â†’            symbol: "GOOGL",
    34â†’            name: "Alphabet Inc.",
    35â†’            lots: [
    36â†’                StockLot(shares: 5, pricePerShare: 2700),
    37â†’                StockLot(shares: 3, pricePerShare: 2800),
    38â†’                StockLot(shares: 2, pricePerShare: 2900)
    39â†’            ],
    40â†’            currentPrice: 3000
    41â†’        )
    42â†’
    43â†’        XCTAssertEqual(stock.totalShares, 10)
    44â†’        // 5*2700 + 3*2800 + 2*2900 = 13500 + 8400 + 5800 = 27700
    45â†’        XCTAssertEqual(stock.totalCost, 27700)
    46â†’        // 27700 / 10 = 2770
    47â†’        XCTAssertEqual(stock.averageCost, 2770)
    48â†’        // 10 * 3000 = 30000
    49â†’        XCTAssertEqual(stock.currentValue, 30000)
    50â†’        // 30000 - 27700 = 2300
    51â†’        XCTAssertEqual(stock.profitLoss, 2300)
    52â†’    }
    53â†’
    54â†’    func testPortfolioAPIFirstPattern() {
    55â†’        // Verify the Portfolio model can be created from API-style data
    56â†’        let portfolio = Portfolio(
    57â†’            stocks: [
    58â†’                Stock(symbol: "AAPL", name: "Apple", lots: [StockLot(shares: 10, pricePerShare: 150)], currentPrice: 160),
    59â†’                Stock(symbol: "MSFT", name: "Microsoft", lots: [StockLot(shares: 5, pricePerShare: 300)], currentPrice: 320)
    60â†’            ],
    61â†’            currency: .usd
    62â†’        )
    63â†’
    64â†’        XCTAssertEqual(portfolio.stocks.count, 2)
    65â†’        // AAPL: 10*160 = 1600, MSFT: 5*320 = 1600 => 3200
    66â†’        XCTAssertEqual(portfolio.totalValue, 3200)
    67â†’        // AAPL: 10*150 = 1500, MSFT: 5*300 = 1500 => 3000
    68â†’        XCTAssertEqual(portfolio.totalCost, 3000)
    69â†’        XCTAssertEqual(portfolio.totalProfitLoss, 200)
    70â†’    }
    71â†’
    72â†’    func testPortfolioCodable() throws {
    73â†’        let portfolio = Portfolio(
    74â†’            stocks: [
    75â†’                Stock(symbol: "AAPL", name: "Apple", lots: [StockLot(shares: 10, pricePerShare: 150)])
    76â†’            ],
    77â†’            currency: .cad
    78â†’        )
    79â†’
    80â†’        let encoder = JSONEncoder()
    81â†’        encoder.dateEncodingStrategy = .iso8601
    82â†’        let data = try encoder.encode(portfolio)
    83â†’
    84â†’        let decoder = JSONDecoder()
    85â†’        decoder.dateDecodingStrategy = .iso8601
    86â†’        let decoded = try decoder.decode(Portfolio.self, from: data)
    87â†’
    88â†’        XCTAssertEqual(decoded.stocks.count, 1)
    89â†’        XCTAssertEqual(decoded.stocks.first?.symbol, "AAPL")
    90â†’        XCTAssertEqual(decoded.currency, .cad)
    91â†’    }
    92â†’
    93â†’    func testEmptyPortfolioDefaults() {
    94â†’        let portfolio = Portfolio()
    95â†’        XCTAssertTrue(portfolio.stocks.isEmpty)
    96â†’        XCTAssertEqual(portfolio.currency, .usd)
    97â†’        XCTAssertNil(portfolio.lastSynced)
    98â†’        XCTAssertEqual(portfolio.totalValue, 0)
    99â†’        XCTAssertEqual(portfolio.totalCost, 0)
   100â†’        XCTAssertEqual(portfolio.totalProfitLoss, 0)
   101â†’        XCTAssertEqual(portfolio.totalProfitLossPercentage, 0)
   102â†’    }

   105â†’
   106â†’    func testStockNotFoundError() {

   108â†’        XCTAssertTrue(error.localizedDescription.contains("AAPL"))

1â†’import Foundation
     2â†’import CoreData
     3â†’import Combine
     4â†’
     5â†’// MARK: - PortfolioRepository
     6â†’/// Repository layer for portfolio Core Data operations
     7â†’@MainActor
     8â†’class PortfolioRepository: ObservableObject {
     9â†’    static let shared = PortfolioRepository()
    10â†’
    11â†’    private let persistenceController = PersistenceController.shared
    12â†’
    13â†’    private var viewContext: NSManagedObjectContext {
    14â†’        persistenceController.viewContext
    15â†’    }
    16â†’
    17â†’    private init() {}
    18â†’
    19â†’    // MARK: - Fetch Operations
    20â†’
    21â†’    /// Fetch all stocks in the portfolio
    22â†’    func fetchAllStocks() throws -> [Stock] {
    23â†’        let request = StockEntity.fetchRequest()
    24â†’        request.sortDescriptors = [NSSortDescriptor(keyPath: \StockEntity.symbol, ascending: true)]
    25â†’
    26â†’        let entities = try viewContext.fetch(request)
    27â†’        return entities.compactMap { entity in
    28â†’            convertToStock(from: entity)
    29â†’        }
    30â†’    }
    31â†’
    32â†’    /// Fetch a specific stock by symbol
    33â†’    func fetchStock(symbol: String) throws -> Stock? {
    34â†’        let request = StockEntity.fetchRequest()
    35â†’        request.predicate = NSPredicate(format: "symbol == %@", symbol)
    36â†’        request.fetchLimit = 1
    37â†’
    38â†’        guard let entity = try viewContext.fetch(request).first else {
    39â†’            return nil
    40â†’        }
    41â†’
    42â†’        return convertToStock(from: entity)
    43â†’    }
    44â†’
    45â†’    /// Fetch a stock by ID
    46â†’    func fetchStock(id: String) throws -> Stock? {
    47â†’        let request = StockEntity.fetchRequest()
    48â†’        request.predicate = NSPredicate(format: "id == %@", id)
    49â†’        request.fetchLimit = 1
    50â†’
    51â†’        guard let entity = try viewContext.fetch(request).first else {
    52â†’            return nil
    53â†’        }
    54â†’
    55â†’        return convertToStock(from: entity)
    56â†’    }
    57â†’
    58â†’    // MARK: - Save Operations
    59â†’
    60â†’    /// Save or update a stock with its lots
    61â†’    func saveStock(_ stock: Stock) throws {
    62â†’        // Check if stock already exists
    63â†’        let request = StockEntity.fetchRequest()
    64â†’        request.predicate = NSPredicate(format: "symbol == %@", stock.symbol)
    65â†’
    66â†’        let existingEntity = try viewContext.fetch(request).first
    67â†’        let stockEntity = existingEntity ?? StockEntity(context: viewContext)
    68â†’
    69â†’        // Update stock properties
    70â†’        stockEntity.id = stock.id
    71â†’        stockEntity.symbol = stock.symbol
    72â†’        stockEntity.name = stock.name
    73â†’        stockEntity.currency = stock.currency
    74â†’        stockEntity.currentPrice = stock.currentPrice ?? 0
    75â†’        stockEntity.previousClose = stock.previousClose ?? 0
    76â†’        stockEntity.lastUpdated = stock.lastUpdated
    77â†’
    78â†’        // Save lots
    79â†’        for lot in stock.lots {
    80â†’            try saveLot(lot, for: stockEntity)
    81â†’        }
    82â†’
    83â†’        try persistenceController.saveContext(viewContext)
    84â†’        AppLogger.portfolio.info("Saved stock: \(stock.symbol)")
    85â†’    }
    86â†’
    87â†’    /// Save a lot for a stock
    88â†’    private func saveLot(_ lot: StockLot, for stockEntity: StockEntity) throws {
    89â†’        // Check if lot exists
    90â†’        let request = StockLotEntity.fetchRequest()
    91â†’        request.predicate = NSPredicate(format: "id == %@", lot.id)
    92â†’
    93â†’        let lotEntity = try viewContext.fetch(request).first ?? StockLotEntity(context: viewContext)
    94â†’
    95â†’        lotEntity.id = lot.id
    96â†’        lotEntity.shares = lot.shares
    97â†’        lotEntity.pricePerShare = lot.pricePerShare
    98â†’        lotEntity.purchaseDate = lot.purchaseDate
    99â†’        lotEntity.currency = lot.currency
   100â†’        lotEntity.notes = lot.notes
